_comment: Created by EFisher on 25/02/2014 18:22:49 using v2.0
title: How has placement to stroke beds changed?
analysis_commentary: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) stroke guidelines launched in 2008 recommend that all people with suspected stroke should be admitted directly to a specialist acute stroke unit following initial assessment either from the community or in an A&E department. In order to measure this, the time taken between arrival at hospital to arrival at a stroke bed is recorded. The proportion of people who arrived at a stroke bed within four hours increased by 11.0 percentage points in 18 months to a high of 65.0% in October to December 2012.
data_source: Royal College of Physicians, National Stroke Audit
